titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Anthony C. Beilenson Papers LSC.0391
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Chuck Wilson and Dan Luckenbill; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2023 August 10.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-15 11:32:00 -0700.

did.abstract: Anthony Charles Beilenson was born on Oct. 26, 1932 in New Rochelle, NY; BA, Harvard Univ., 1954; LL.B, Harvard Univ. Law School, 1957; admitted to CA bar in 1957, and began practice in Beverly Hills; worked as counsel, CA State Assembly Committee on Finance and Insurance, 1960; served in CA State Assembly, 1963-66; served in CA State Senate, 1967-76, where he chaired the Senate Committee on Health and Welfare (1968-74) and the Senate Finance Committee (1975-76); authored more than 200 state laws, including the Therapeutic Abortion Act of 1967, the Auto Repair Fraud Act of 1971, and the Funeral Reform Act of 1971; served as a Democrat in the US House of Representatives, 1977-97; became chair of the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (1989-90), and served on the House Budget Committee (1988-94), and the House Rules Committee; did not stand as a candidate for re-election in 1996.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audiovisual materials. Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the series and file levels. All requests to access processed digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Anthony C. Beilenson Papers (Collection Number 391). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Chuck Wilson and Dan Luckenbill.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Anthony Charles Beilenson was born on Oct. 26, 1932 in New Rochelle, NY; BA, Harvard Univ., 1954; LL.B, Harvard Univ. Law School, 1957; admitted to CA bar in 1957, and began practice in Beverly Hills; worked as counsel, CA State Assembly Committee on Finance and Insurance, 1960; served in CA State Assembly, 1963-66; served in CA State Senate, 1967-76, where he chaired the Senate Committee on Health and Welfare (1968-74) and the Senate Finance Committee (1975-76); authored more than 200 state laws, including the Therapeutic Abortion Act of 1967, the Auto Repair Fraud Act of 1971, and the Funeral Reform Act of 1971; served as a Democrat in the US House of Representatives, 1977-97; became chair of the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (1989-90), and served on the House Budget Committee (1988-94), and the House Rules Committee; did not stand as a candidate for re-election in 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Boxes 1-168 and 4 oversize boxes include legislative bill files, correspondence, memos, newsclippings, campaign materials, reports, and videotapes relating to Beilenson's political career as a CA state assemblyman, state senator, and member of the US House of Representatives.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Securing liberal legislation during the Reagan administration [oral history transcript] / Anthony C. Beilenson, interviewee. UCLA Oral History Department interview, c1982. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.

Oral history interview with Anthony C. Beilenson [oral history transcript] 1997-1998 / by Susan Douglass Yates. [1998] UCLA Oral History Program. 2 vols. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.p: Beilenson, Anthony C. What future for the Santa Monicas? Reprinted from National Parks & Conservation Magazine. 1978 Feb. Remarks at Santa Monica Mountains and Seashore Foundation conference, The National Significance of the Santa Monica Mountains and Seashore. ca. 1981 Nov. 11 l. numbered 27 - [37]. Typescript (photocopy) with ACB's corrections. Beilenson, Anthony C. The Santa Monicas. Reprinted from National Parks Magazine. 1982 Jan / Feb. Statement of Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson before the Los Angeles City Council Planning Committee. 1982 Jun 1. 2 l. Typescript (photocopy). ACB KCRW script. 1983 Jun 30. [2] l. Typescript (photocopy). Letter to the editor, The Daily News. 1998 Mar 4. [2] l. Typescript (photocopy). Security of Federal Funds Has slowed, but not Stopped, Santa Monica's Land Purchases. In: Mountain Conservancy News. 1987 May (v.4 no.4). Remarks of Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson on the tenth anniversary of the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area. 1988 Oct 23. [4] l. Typescript (photocopy). Comments of congressman Anthony C. Beilenson transfer of Circle X and Zuma Canyon to NPS. 1989 Mar 6. [2] l. Typescript (photocopy). Letter to the editor, The Daily News. 1989 Aug 3. [2] l. Typescript (photocopy). Letter to the editor, Courier (National Park Service). 1988 Aug 23. [1] l. Congressman Beilenson condemns plan for landfill in Mission, Rustic, and Sullivan Canyons; announces $12 million appropriation for Santa Monicas. 1990 Oct 30. [1] l. Typescript (photocopy). Statement of Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson regarding Mission, Rustic and Sullivan Canyons. 1990 Oct 30. [1] l. Typescript (photocopy). Statement of Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson "Hands Across the Mountains." 1991 Apr 7 (Sunday). 2 l. Typescript (FAX). Statement of Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson before the California Coastal Commission. 1991 Jan 10. [2] l. Typescript (photocopy). Statement of congressman Anthony C. Beilenson "March for Parks." 1991 May 5 (Sunday). [2] l. Typescript (FAX). Statement by Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson for the 75th anniversary celebration of the National Park Service. 1991 Aug 25. [2] l. Typescript (photocopy). Statement of U.S. Representative Anthony C. Beilenson regarding the Santa Monica Mountains Enforcement Task Force. 1992 Jul 23. [2] l. Typescript (photocopy). Together with other documents. Statement of congressman Anthony C. Beilenson at the Multicultural Festival Paramount Ranch. 1992 Sep 12. 5 l. Typescript (large font, printer copy). Marked: Used? Not sure. Scarcity of federal funds has slowed - but not stopped - Santa Monicas Lands purchases. No date. [3] l. Typescript (photocopy). Cf. article published this title 1987. Draft op - ed article. No date (ca. 1981). [3] l. Typescript (photocopy)

Includes manuscript as rejected by Los Angeles Times and New York Times: One single answer to many problems: raise the gasoline tax. 4 l. Typescript. Also clipping (photocopy) from The Washington Post: We can pay a gas tax, or we can pay OPEC, by Anthony C. Beilenson. 1989 Jan 10 (Tues)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with editors, manuscripts, clippings. Includes [rejected]: The Medicare Catastrophic Protection Act: good intentions, bad results. No date. 4 l. Typescript. Also: We need true catastrophic insurance: Congress' costly plan won't provide the protection its name implies. No date. 4 l. Typescript with extensive holograph corrections. Also other versions. Also clipping (photocopy) as published with title: A 'catastrophic' bill, by Anthony C. Beilenson. In unknown publication, no date

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with editors, manuscripts, clippings. Includes: Statement of Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson regarding H.R. 3471 establishing a Department of Veterans' Affairs. 1988 Oct 6. [3] l. Typescript. Also: other versions. Also: A Department of Veterans Affairs is a terrible idea: instead, we should reform most veterans' programs. 7 l. Typescript with holograph corrections. Also: Proofs from The Washington Post. 1988 Jan 11. ca. 10 l. Typescript (FAX)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, clippings. Includes: Statement of Congressman Anthony C. Beilenson Not all elderly oppose Social Security reductions. 1987 Dec 14. 4 l. Typescript (photocopy). Also: As read into the CR. Also: Why not Social Security? By Anthony C. Beilenson. No date. 4 l. Typescript. Also as published in The Washington Post: Put Social Security on the table. Clipping (photocopy). No date

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes, memos, background interviews. These files date from the mid 1960s to the 1990s, and thus span ACB's career in the California legislature and Congress. Dates are for the grouping of folders. Only one folder had a subtitle (Family planning bill HR 11007) and materials from various dates are interfiled in the folders. Early listed folders have notes and memo information, the remainder seem to be research material used for a variety of population control legislation introduced by ACB state and national: contraception, abortion, family planning, welfare reform, etc
